title: 5+ Billion Passwords in Order of Most Popular

why howwhile was able locate few password wordlists were sorted popularity, vast majority lists, especially larger lists, were sorted alphabetically. seems a major practicality flaw! we assume the common password is password, ( is actually 2nd common, 123456) we are performing dictionary attack using english dictionary, are going have slog aardvark through passover get password. don't off top my head how common "aardvark" is a password - we be wasting lot time not starting the common password our list! went seclists, weakpass, hashes.org downloaded nearly every single wordlist containing real passwords could find. lists were huge, i ended with 80 gb actual, human-generated used passwords. were split among 350 files varying length, sorting scheme, character encoding, origin other properties. sorted files, removed duplicates within files themselves, prepared join all together. of lists were composed the lists, some were exact duplicates. took care remove exact duplicate files - didn't need have avoidable false positives. a password was found across multiple files, considered to an approximation its popularity. an entry was found 5 files, wasn't too popular. an entry be found 300 files, was very popular. using unix commands, concatenated the files one giant file representing keys over 4 billion secret areas the web, sorted by number appearances the single file. this, was able create large wordlist sorted popularity, the alphabet. addition the world's common passwords -
